title: Seaview Wildlife Encounter
text:
Seaview Wildlife Encounter, (formerly Flamingo Park), was a <a href="wildlife%20park">wildlife park</a> featuring non-<a href="indigenous%20%28ecology%29">native species</a> of birds and mammals. It opened in 1971 and closed in November 2015. The visitor attraction was located in the town of <a href="Seaview%2C%20Isle%20of%20Wight">Seaview</a>, on the northeast coast of the <a href="Isle%20of%20Wight">Isle of Wight</a>. The Isle of Wight is a small British island 3 to 5 mi (5 to 8 km) off the coast of <a href="South%20East%20England">South East England</a>.
Features.
Animals at the reserve included <a href="meerkat">meerkat</a>s, <a href="wallaby">wallaby</a>s, <a href="flamingo">flamingo</a>s, <a href="pelican">pelican</a>s, <a href="duck">duck</a>s, <a href="swan">swan</a>s, <a href="alpaca">alpaca</a>s, <a href="otter">otter</a>s, <a href="penguin">penguin</a>s, and <a href="parakeet">parakeet</a>s.
Visitors could feed the ducks and stroke the wallabies.
The site also included a gift shop and cafeteria.
